ax.ha.it.smsalarm

Class AcknowledgeHandler.ListenToPhoneState

  • java.lang.Object
    • PhoneStateListener
      • ax.ha.it.smsalarm.AcknowledgeHandler.ListenToPhoneState
  • Enclosing class:
    AcknowledgeHandler

    private class AcknowledgeHandler.ListenToPhoneState
extends PhoneStateListener
    Checks the different phone states while placing a call. With that information given, we can arrange automatic redial functionality in this parent class AcknowledgeHandler.
    Since:
    2.1
    Version:
    2.2
    Author:
    Robert Nyholm

    • Method Detail

      • onCallStateChanged

        public void onCallStateChanged(int state,
                      String incomingNumber)
        An inherited method to check when call state has changed. This implementation of that method helps to make an automatic redial.
        See Also:
        swapStates(int), stateName(int), logCat(LogPriorities, String , String), logCat(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable), setPrefs(PrefKeys, PrefKeys, Object, Context)

        To get phone state as String.
        Parameters:
        state - Phone state as Integer
        Returns:
        Phone state as String resolved from Integer
        See Also:

      • swapStates

        void swapStates(int currentState)
        To swap phone states in a way that we have both the previous phone state and current phone state stored.
        Parameters:
        currentState - Phone state to be stored as the current phone state
        See Also:
        onCallStateChanged(int, String), logCat(LogPriorities, String , String)
